page.title: 19Three Schools, Alcester
page.content: Two schools take children up to the age of eleven. One is an R.C. primary school called Our Lady's, which has 94 children in 3 classes. The other, Kinwarton House, is a small private school with 28 children in 4 classes. The youngest are 3 years old. We think people pay for their children to go there because it is a lovely, 200-year old building with attractive grounds. The children have pleasant surroundings in which to play, and, because classes are small, they get a lot of attention from adults and a good chance to use things like the computer. The third school, the Greville High School, is a secondary modern school for 344 children between 11 and 16. In September 1985 it will join with Bidford High School and will be known as Alcester High School.
